page.title: 13JACK THE GIANT KILLER
page.content: Long, long ago, the Giant Cormoran lived on the island of St. Michael's Mount. Also living was a farmer with his son, Jack. The giant kept coming to eat cattle, sheep, pigs and even people themselves. One day the people had a meeting. Jack said, "I'll get rid of the giant for you." At evening, when the sun had just gone down, Jack went up tothe giant's castle with his sword and his father's spade. He dug a pit and covered it with branches and put soil on top to disguise it. It was dawn when he had finished. Jack called "Wake up lazy-bones! You'll pay for this, silly old fool!" The giant was very angry. He chased Jack out of his catle and down the hill. His steps were as loud as thunder. He fell in the pit. Jack took his sword and cut off the giant's head. Then he went home with the giant's treasure.
